name: benzenesulfonamide, 4-[(phenylmethyl)amino]-
Reason:
The target compound, benzenesulfonamide, 4-[(phenylmethyl)amino]-, consists of a benzene ring with a sulfonamide group (S(=O)(=O)N), an amino group (NH2), and another phenyl group (C6H5) attached through a methylene bridge (CH2). The basic benzene unit has a melting point of 5.5°C. We anticipate the following effects on the melting point: 
- Sulfonamide group: +80°C (due to its ability to form strong intermolecular hydrogen bonds and resonance stabilization) 
- Amino group: +50°C (due to its capacity for hydrogen bonding, which increases the compound's lattice energy) 
- Phenyl group: +30°C (due to increased molecular weight and π-π interactions) 
- Methylene bridge: +10°C (due to a slight increase in molecular size) 
The additive impacts should yield a shift in the melting point relative to benzene.
